Key Match Events: Pakistan have kept their semi-final hopes alive with victory in a rain-reduced, much-win match over their favourite opponents: South Africa.
Pakistan have also emerged victorious from six of their last nine World Cup meetings against South Africa - including two fifty-over World Cup wins.
Shaheen Shah Afridi dismissed Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw cheaply but Temba Bavuma had his best innings of 2022 and the chase was going well until the start of the eighth over.
An hour’s interruption cut six overs off the chase and when play resumed South Africa needed 75 runs off the remaining five overs.
Tristan Stubbs and Heinrich Klaasen biffed it around a bit but the ask was always going to be too tall.
South Africa remain second on the points’ table and need to beat Netherlands on Sunday to keep their fate in their own hands.
Pre-Game Insights: Mohammad Haris is a straight swap for Fakhar Zaman in the XI.
Babar Azam decides to bat. "The pitch looks decent," he says.
Temba Bavuma has been ruled out of the match as a precautionary measure due to lower back muscle spasm so Heinrich Klaasen plays.
Tabraiz Shamsi has been preferred over Keshav Maharaj.
Miscellaneous Highlights: On a chilly Sydney evening, against the express pace of Anrich Nortje and the craftiness of Lungi Ngidi’s slower ball, Pakistan recovered from 95 for 5 to post their fifth-highest score against South Africa, and highest at World Cups.
